intro: Cavendishia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Cavendishia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup. The plant produces striking, colorful inflorescences that bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
